Highest documented mangrove carbon stocks globally (1,023 Mg C/ha)
Documented $3.3B ecosystem service loss demonstrates degradation risk quantification
Home to only mangrove-adapted Bengal tiger population
Massive untapped blue carbon credit potential
demo_value.investor_story: The Sundarbans represents both the greatest opportunity and the starkest warning in blue carbon finance. Storing 91 Tg of carbon across 4,200 km2 - the world's largest mangrove carbon stock - it generates $779M/year in ecosystem services while protecting 4.5 million people from Bay of Bengal cyclones. Yet $3.3B in ecosystem value has already been lost over 45 years to degradation. Nereus rates the Sundarbans A - extraordinary ecological value with material governance and climate risks that blue finance instruments must address.
